meanings.definition: A thick paste made of bread crumbs and milk, used as a base for soups or puddings.
meanings.sent1: The chef added panada to the soup to make it thicker.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the creamy texture of the panada in her pudding.
meanings.sent3: The panada in the soup looked like a fluffy cloud floating on top.
meanings.sent4: Her cooking secret was using panada as the foundation for all her recipes.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly made panada filled the kitchen with warmth.

meanings.definition: A soft, bland food made by boiling bread in water or milk.
meanings.sent1: He ate the panada slowly, savoring its simple taste.
meanings.sent2: The hospital served panada to patients who needed easy-to-digest meals.
meanings.sent3: The panada reminded him of his childhood, when his grandma made it for him.
meanings.sent4: In times of sickness, panada became his comforting companion.
meanings.sent5: The panada melted in his mouth, bringing a sense of comfort and nostalgia.
